jyVis.visualizationPrimitives
Class VisualizationPrimitive

java.lang.Object
  jyVis.visualizationPrimitives.VisualizationPrimitive
Direct Known Subclasses:
Circle, Image, Line, Polygon, Rectangle
public abstract class VisualizationPrimitive
extends java.lang.Object

The base class of all 2D objects for use with JyVis.

Author:
Curran Kelleher

Field Detail

color

public java.awt.Color color
The color of this object. The default is black.

drawOutline

public boolean drawOutline
A flag which determines whether or not an outline will be drawn around this object. This is false by default

fill

public boolean fill
A flag which determines whether or not this object will be filled in. This is true by default

Draws this object, using the transformation information calculated in computeWindowTransformation().

Parameters:
g - the Graphics to draw this object on
w - the window to use for coordinate-space to pixel-space transformations.

contains

public boolean contains(java.awt.Point point)
Determines whether or not this object will be selected when the mouse is clicked at the specified point. Usually, the implementation of this returns true if point is inside the object. False is returned if this method is not implemented.

Parameters:
point - the point where the mouse was clicked
Returns:
true if this object will be selected by the user clicking at point "point" on the drawing panel

setUpForSelection

public void setUpForSelection(DataRecord record,
                              DrawingPanel panel)
Sets up this object to work with selection. This means that this graphical object is associated with the specified record, and is selectable, and will be drawn as selected, in the specified JVDrawingPanel.

Parameters:
record - the data record to link this object to
panel - the drawing panel which will draw this object when it is selected, and will also be a means of selecting the record associated with this object.

getSelectablePoints

public java.util.List<java.awt.Point> getSelectablePoints()
Gets the points which make this object selected if they are inside the selection polygon. If null is returned, then this object will not be selectable. null is returned if this method is not implemented.

getAssociatedRecord

public DataRecord getAssociatedRecord()
Returns:
the record associated with this object, or null if this object has no associated record

record

public int record()
Returns:
the index of the record associated with this object, or 0 if this object has no associated record

getBoundingBox

public abstract java.awt.Rectangle getBoundingBox()
Returns the bounding box of this object (in pixel space)

Returns:
the bounding box of this object
